episodes.title: Marina Hyde on Epstein’s enablers: will they get away with it? – The Latest
episodes.description: The latest tranche of Epstein files has sent shock waves around the world, but many of the powerful men who minimised and dismissed his crimes are still yet to face any real consequences. The documents show the likes of Noam Chomsky and Steve Bannon were happy to maintain relationships with Epstein even after he spent time in jail for child sex offences. What message does that send to the abused women and girls, whose experiences should be the real focus? And will these men ever be held to account? Lucy Hough speaks to the Guardian columnist Marina Hyde – watch on YouTube. Help support our independent journalism at theguardian.com/infocus

episodes.title: Could Mandelson face jail time over Epstein ties? – The Latest
episodes.description: Peter Mandelson faces a criminal investigation over allegations he leaked Downing Street emails and market-sensitive information to the child sex offender Jeffrey Epstein in 2009. The Metropolitan police are investigating Mandelson, who was then business secretary, on suspicion of misconduct in public office, an offence that carries a maximum sentence of life imprisonment. Police are also reviewing fresh allegations about the former prince Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor. Lucy Hough speaks to the head of national news, Archie Bland – watch on YouTube . Help support our independent journalism at theguardian.com/infocus

episodes.title: Epstein files: has Trump really been ‘absolved’? | The Latest
episodes.description:
Donald Trump claims that the release of millions more files related to Jeffrey Epstein 'absolve' him of wrongdoing, even though his name appears hundreds of times.
Subscribe ► https://www.youtube.com/@todayinfocuspodcast?sub_confirmation=1

The latest documents also indicate high-profile figures , including the former prince Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor and Labour peer Peter Mandelson, continued friendships with the disgraced financier after his child sex abuse convictions. So what have we learned from the newly released files and what happens next? Lucy Hough speaks to columnist and host of Politics Weekly America Jonathan Freedland

Chapters:
00:00 - Introduction
00:37 - Trump’s claim he is “absolved” by new Epstein files
03:00 - When will more files be released?
04:43 - New photos related to Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor
07:24 - Calls for Mountbatten-Windsor and Mandelson to face Congress

episodes.title: The long-awaited release of the Epstein files | The Latest
episodes.description:
The US Department of Justice is expected to release files relating to the disgraced late financier and sex trafficker, Jeffrey Epstein, this evening. The Trump administration is obliged to publish a massive archive of documents that could shed further light on Epstein’s misdeeds and his connections with key public figures - including Trump himself.
Subscribe ► https://www.youtube.com/@todayinfocuspodcast?sub_confirmation=1

Chapters:
00:00 - Epstein back in the spotlight as file deadline looms
00:36 - What are the Epstein files and what will actually be released?
02:02 - Why Trump is now legally forced to release the documents
02:51 - Trump, Epstein and the political damage of proximity
 03:45 - New release of 68 photos: powerful figures named
 05:28 - Being named is not evidence of wrongdoing
 06:06 - Why Epstein has become a breaking point for Trump’s MAGA base
 07:05 - Republicans’ dilemma and midterm election fears
 08:26 - Will redactions fuel more conspiracy theories?
 09:12 - Why this story is unlikely to go away
